theme: यतो वा इमानि भूतानि जायन्ते येन जातानि जीवन्ति यत् प्रयन्त्यभिसंविशन्ति (तैत्तिरीयो. ३-१), तत्सृष्ट्वा तदेवानुप्राविशत्। तदनुप्रविश्य सच्च (तैत्तिरीयो. २-६), तस्माद्वा एतस्मादात्मन आकाशः (तैत्तिरीयो. २-१), यश्च विश्वं सृजति विश्वं बिभर्ति विश्व भुङ्क्ते स आत्मा (शाण्डिल्योप. २-१)
meaning: Meaning: From which comes the origin (or beginning) of this (world).Explanation: This verse, taken from the Brahma Sutras, is the opening sutra of the entire text. It implies that there exists a supreme reality, from which the origin of this world and everything in it arises. The sutra does not explicitly mention the nature or form of this ultimate reality, leaving it open to interpretation by different philosophical schools. However, it lays the foundation for the subsequent discussions on the nature of this reality and its relationship with the universe.
